info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 1:12PM PDT until September 17 at 3:11PM PDT by NWS San Diego CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego.
* WHEN...Until 311 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 112 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Valley Center, Palomar Mountain, Hwy 79 Between Oak Grove And Aguanga, Palomar Mountain State Park, S7 - East Grade Rd, Hwy 79 Between Warner Springs And Oak Grove, Aguanga, Oak Grove, La Jolla Indian Reservation and Pauma Valley. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 311 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON
